result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Howard Harriman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark Howard Harriman appeared by video.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Mark Howard Harriman.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a date for plea and sentencing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mark Howard Harriman appeared by video.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Mark Howard Harriman.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Defendant Mark Howard Harriman in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark Howard Harriman appeared by video means.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defendant is not SPD eligible. Counsel has not been retained. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered the  remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mark Howard Harriman in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant requesting a hearing
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7-28-2022 @1p
